Class AccountsManager

java.lang.Object
AccountsManager
public class AccountsManager extends Object
The AccountsManager class manages user accounts, including sign up, login, verification, and OTP generation and verification.

  • Method Details

    • signUp

      public LoggedInUser signUp() throws IOException
      The function allows a user to sign up by inputting their name, email, and password, and verifies their email and OTP before adding them to the list of users and logging them in.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a LoggedInUser object.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • login

      public LoggedInUser login()
      The function takes user input for email and password, creates an account object, verifies the account, and returns a LoggedInUser object if successful.
      Returns:
      A LoggedInUser object is being returned. If the verification of the user's email and password is successful, a new LoggedInUser object is created with the user's account information. If the verification fails, an empty LoggedInUser object is returned.

    • verification

      public boolean verification(Account account)
      The function checks if an account's email and password match with any of the logged in users' email and password.
      Parameters:
      account - An object of the class Account, which contains the email and password of a user trying to log in.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a boolean value. It returns true if the email and password of the given account match with any of the email and password of the accounts stored in the users list, otherwise it returns false.

    • addUser

      public void addUser(LoggedInUser user)
      This function adds a LoggedInUser object to a list of users.
      Parameters:
      user - The parameter "user" is an object of the class "LoggedInUser" that is being passed as an argument to the method "addUser". This method adds the user object to a collection of users.

    • accDataFlush

      public void accDataFlush(String userName, String email, String password) throws IOException
      This function writes user account data (username, email, and password) to a file.
      Parameters:
      userName - The username of the user being registered.
      email - The email parameter is a string variable that represents the email address of a registered user.
      password - The password parameter is a String variable that represents the password of a user. It is used as an input parameter for the accDataFlush method, which writes the user's information (including their password) to a file.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • generateOTP

      public String generateOTP()
      This Java function generates a 6-digit random OTP (one-time password) using numbers 0-9.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a randomly generated 6-digit OTP (One-Time Password) as a String.

    • sendOTP

      public String sendOTP(String recipient)
      The function sends an email containing a generated OTP to a specified recipient using Gmail's SMTP server.
      Parameters:
      recipient - The email address of the recipient who will receive the OTP.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String which is the OTP (One Time Password) generated and sent to the recipient's email address.

    • OTPVerification

      public boolean OTPVerification(String OTP)
      The function takes user input for an OTP code and returns true if it matches the given OTP.
      Parameters:
      OTP - The OTP parameter is a string representing the One-Time Password that needs to be verified.
      Returns:
      A boolean value is being returned. It will be true if the input OTP matches the OTP passed as a parameter, and false otherwise.

    • checkEmail

      public boolean checkEmail(String emailStr)
      The function checks if a given string matches the pattern of a valid email address.
      Parameters:
      emailStr - The email address that needs to be checked for validity.
      Returns:
      A boolean value indicating whether the input string matches the email regular expression pattern.
